meanings.definition: Make the best or most effective use of (a situation, opportunity, or resource).
meanings.sent1: She optimises her time by creating a schedule and sticking to it.
meanings.sent2: He optimises his study sessions by focusing on the most important topics first.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel optimises its nut-gathering strategy by choosing the shortest route.
meanings.sent4: The coach optimises the team's performance by analyzing each player's strengths and weaknesses.
meanings.sent5: The chef optimises the flavors in the dish by adding just the right amount of seasoning.

meanings.definition: Modify (a system) to make it as fully functional or effective as possible.
meanings.sent1: The IT specialist optimises the computer network for faster data transfer.
meanings.sent2: They optimise the production line to increase efficiency and reduce waste.
meanings.sent3: The robot optimises its movements to dance perfectly in sync with the music.
meanings.sent4: The gardener optimises the irrigation system to ensure all plants receive enough water.
meanings.sent5: The architect optimises the building design to maximize natural light and ventilation.
